description: On the occasion of our 250th podcast, we’re celebrating with this bonus mini-episode, compiling a year’s worth of our show-starting jokes into one convenient package. These tiny tales of stuff walking into bars, bad trips to the doctor and lightbulbs in need of changing come courtesy of guests like Jonah Hill, Carrie Brownstein, The Arctic […]
contentencoded:
On the occasion of our 250th podcast, we’re celebrating with this bonus mini-episode, compiling a year’s worth of our show-starting jokes into one convenient package. These tiny tales of stuff walking into bars, bad trips to the doctor and lightbulbs in need of changing come courtesy of guests like Jonah Hill, Carrie Brownstein, The Arctic Monkeys, Tavi Gevinson, Jim Jarmusch, Timothy Olyphant, and dozens more. Some are funny… most are not. But there are definitely a lot of them. Enjoy!





“A Space, Man” – Hugh Bonneville

Actor, aka Lord Grantham of “Downton Abbey”



“Two Cupcakes” – Jonah Hill

Oscar nominee for “Wolf Of Wall Street” and “Moneyball”



 


“Interrupting Feral Pig” – Jonathan Goldstein

Author and host of “Wire Tap”




“Knock Knock x 3” – Daniel Post-Senning & Lizzie Post

Etiquette experts and co-authors of “Emily Post’s Etiquette”



 


“Waldo’s Stripes” – Judy Greer

Co-star of “The Descendants,” “Arrested Development,” and many more




“The Mummy’s Soundtrack” – Joanna Hershon

Author of the novel “A Dual Inheritance”



 


“The Chiropractor’s Soundtrack” – Annabelle Gurwitch

Author and former host of “Dinner and A Movie”




“A Well-Dressed Gator” – Lance Bangs

Director of rock music videos and the Slint documentary “Breadcrumb Trail”




“Dancing Kleenex” – Carrie Brownstein

Co-creator of “Portlandia,” ex-frontwoman of Wild Flag and Sleater-Kinney



“Hummingbirds” – Noah Strycker

Professional bird nerd and author of “The Thing with Feathers”



 


“Actors on Lightbulbs” – Sam Harris

Actor and author of the showbiz memoir “Ham”




“Hip Lightbulbs” – Jordan Vogt-Roberts

Director of “The Kings of Summer” and “Nick Offerman: American Ham.”




“Ironic Misogynist Joke” – Tavi Gevinson

Feminist, Rookie Magazine editor-in-chief, stage and film actor



“Purple Stuff” – Steve

Citizen of Salt Lake City and valued DPD listener




“Bar Food” – Jim Jarmusch

Pioneering indie filmmaker, coolest man in world



“A Fun Guy” – Ashley Cardiff

Author of the comedic essay collection “Night Terrors”



 


“Whispering Peanuts” – Ellin Stein

Comedy historian, author, and “National Lampoon” scholar


“Hidden Steak” – Steve Okonski

Keyboardist for indie-psych band Diane Coffee



 


“Drummer At the Door” – Michael Fitzpatrick

aka “Fitz” of New-Wave soulsters Fitz & the Tantrums




“Shoot the Violinist” – Margaret Batjer

World-renowned violinist, concertmaster of the L.A. Chamber Orchestra



 


“Penguin Semi-Joke” – Andrew Bujalski

Writer-director of “Computer Chess,” godfather of “mumblecore”


“Eating Right” – Sherill Tippins

Author of the Chelsea Hotel history “Inside The Dream Palace.”


 




“Just Kiddin’!” – Timothy Olyphant

Star of TV’s “Justified”


“His Dying Wish(es)” – Carol Leifer

Standup comic, TV comedy writer, and memoirist




“Bad Luck Wife” – Gary Shteyngart

Bestselling author of “Absurdistan” and the recent memoir “Little Failure”



“Tough Customers” – Zach Schwartz

Aka Zach Rogue, frontman of the band Rogue Wave



 


“I’ll Be the Neck” – Lidia Bastianich

Celebrity chef, uber-restaurateur and host of PBS’ “Lidia’s Italy”




“Canadian Sex” – Margaret Atwood

Canuck author of dystopian classics including “The Handmaid’s Tale”




“Wheeled Pirate” – Peaches

Electro-provocateur, creator of autobiographical musical “Peaches Does Herself”


“Igorance or Apathy?” – Kenny Vance

Pop musician, producer, member of doo-wop hitmakers Jay & the Americans




“An Only Child” – Baz Luhrmann

Singular writer/director of “Moulin Rouge” and “The Great Gatsby”


“Archery” – Austin Brown

Guitarist for punk band Parquet Courts



 


“Chicken: Surprised” – Sherill Tippins

Author of the Chelsea Hotel history “Inside The Dream Palace.”




“Brown & Sticky” – Ben Schott

Compiler of trivia, author of “Schott’s Miscellany” and “Schottenfreude”



 


“Nixon in the Kitchen” – Penny Lane

Director of the documentary “Our Nixon”




“A Swiss Roll” – Alex Turner & Matt Helders

Frontman and drummer of UK rock superstars The Arctic Monkeys


 



 


“A Little Whine” – Ruth Reichl

Pioneering food writer, final editor of Gourmet magazine, novelist


“Octopus Soldier” – Aaron Aites & Audrey Ewell

Directors,“99%: The Occupy Wall Street Collaborative Film,” “Until the Light Takes Us”



 


“Six-Legged Beast” – Isabella Manfredi & Gideon Benson

Frontfolk for Aussie rock band The Preatures



“Scary Math” – Lars Ulrich

Co-founder and drummer of Metallica

These tiny tales of stuff walking into bars, bad trips to the doctor and lightbulbs in need of changing come courtesy of guests like Jonah Hill, Carrie Brownstein, The Arctic […]
